title: sokani
author: sokani
content: Last year, The Federal Government of Nigeria through the National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA) launched a blockchain developer scholarship program to train 30,000 Nigerians. The program was spearheaded by Domineum Blockchain Solution and today the graduands were presented certificate of completion by the honourable minister of communications and digital economy Prof. Issa Pantani in Abuja. Congratulations to the beneficiaries and let's hope more good things will come out of this.https://twitter.com/NITDANigeria/status/1658530372936691712?t=dyK_vwB9TKNIUpQuw1nNYQ&s=19

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: sokani on May 16, 2023, 10:59:55 PMLast year, The Federal Government of Nigeria through the National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA) launched a blockchain developer scholarship program to train 30,000 Nigerians. The program was spearheaded by Domineum Blockchain Solution and today the graduands were presented certificate of completion by the honourable minister of communications and digital economy Prof. Issa Pantani in Abuja. Congratulations to the beneficiaries and let's hope more good things will come out of this.https://twitter.com/NITDANigeria/status/1658530372936691712?t=dyK_vwB9TKNIUpQuw1nNYQ&s=19There's what we called educated illiteracy and this is the same direction the governments were approaching the matters related to the blockchain technology, if they can accept blockchain technology but deny bitcoin which is the major dependent of the technology, doesn't it seems like they gave personal intentions that could be of interest to them than the people when they kick against bitcoin adoption, such could also give them the more edge in having control over the people's finances, which is the main idea Satoshi focused on and preached about when he introduced a digital currency bitcoin, I wish all the beneficiaries could see beyond blockchain alone but also give more room to bitcoin adoption with their impact in cryptocurrency.
